hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >5% intraday price spike on low volume (<80% of 20-day average) following liquidity-related news headlines, price will revert >60% of the spike within 48 hours as temporary liquidity fails to sustain momentum.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven liquidity narratives often create temporary buying pressure that evaporates when actual on-chain/orderbook liquidity doesn't support the move. Low volume confirms weak participation.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle closes with >5% gain from previous close
Volume during spike candle <80% of 20-day average hourly volume
News sentiment score (crypto headlines) shows 'liquidity' keyword spike within 2 hours

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 60% of the initial spike move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new high above spike candle by 1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >50% of such spikes lead to continuation (not reversal) over 48h window in backtest across 2023-2024 data.
